Component.description: Category of metadata (e.g. Tools, Publications, etc.); provide the same one for all items/rows.
Component.title: Component

Filename.description: The path of a file in Synapse, relative to the project. The file associated with the path will be annotated with attributes contained in this sheet.
Filename.title: Filename

ImageDimensionOrder.description: The order in which the individual planes of data are interleaved.
ImageDimensionOrder.title: Image Dimension Order

ImageFOVIndex.description: Index of FOV (as it pertains to its sequence order). Integer >= 1
ImageFOVIndex.title: Image FOV Index

ImageFOVSizeX.description: Field of view X dimension. Floating point
ImageFOVSizeX.title: Image FOV Size X

ImageFOVSizeXUnit.description: Field of view X dimension units. See OME enumeration of allowed values for the UnitsLength attribute -- default: microns (um)
ImageFOVSizeXUnit.title: Image FOV Size X Unit

ImageFOVSizeY.description: Field  of view Y dimension. Floating point value
ImageFOVSizeY.title: Image FOV Size Y

ImageFOVSizeYUnit.description: Field of view Y dimension units. See OME enumeration of allowed values for the UnitsLength attribute -- default: microns (um)
ImageFOVSizeYUnit.title: Image FOV Size Y Unit

ImageFrameAveraging.description: Number of frames averaged together (if no averaging, set to 1). Integer >= 1
ImageFrameAveraging.title: Image Frame Averaging

ImageIdentifier.description: Unique internal image identifier. eg "Image:0". (To be extracted from OME-XML)
ImageIdentifier.title: Image Identifier

ImageLenseAperture.description: The numerical aperture of the lens. Floating point value > 0.
ImageLenseAperture.title: Image Lense Aperture

ImageNominalMagnification.description: The magnification of the lens as specified by the manufacturer - i.e. '60' is a 60X lens. floating point value > 1(no units)
ImageNominalMagnification.title: Image Nominal Magnification

ImagePhysicalSizeX.description: Physical size (X-dimension) of a pixel. Units are set by PhysicalSizeXUnit. Floating point value > 0.
ImagePhysicalSizeX.title: Image Physical Size X

ImagePhysicalSizeXUnit.description: The units of the physical size of a pixel. See OME enumeration of allowed values for the UnitsLength attribute -- default: microns (um)
ImagePhysicalSizeXUnit.title: Image Physical Size X Unit

ImagePhysicalSizeY.description: Physical size (Y-dimension) of a pixel. Units are set by PhysicalSizeYUnit. Floating point value > 0.
ImagePhysicalSizeY.title: Image Physical Size Y

ImagePhysicalSizeYUnit.description: The units of the physical size of a pixel. See OME enumeration of allowed values for the UnitsLength attribute -- default: microns (um)
ImagePhysicalSizeYUnit.title: Image Physical Size Y Unit

ImagePhysicalSizeZ.description: Physical size (Z-dimension) of a pixel. Units are set by PhysicalSizeZUnit. Floating point value > 0.
ImagePhysicalSizeZ.title: Image Physical Size Z

ImagePhysicalSizeZUnit.description: The units of the physical size of a pixel. See OME enumeration of allowed values for the UnitsLength attribute -- default: microns (um)
ImagePhysicalSizeZUnit.title: Image Physical Size Z Unit

ImagePixelType.description: Data type for each pixel value. E.g. "uint16"
ImagePixelType.title: Image Pixel Type

ImagePlaneCount.description: Number of Z-planes (not to be confused with downsampled "pyramid"). Integer >=1
ImagePlaneCount.title: Image Plane Count

ImagePlatformManufacturer.description: Producer of the imaging equipment that was used to generate the digital image
ImagePlatformManufacturer.title: Image Platform Manufacturer

ImagePlatformModel.description: The specific model of the instrument used to carry out an imaging experiment.
ImagePlatformModel.title: Image Platform Model

ImageProtocolLink.description: Protocols.io ID or DOI link to a free/open protocol resource describing in detail the assay protocol (e.g. surface markers used in Smart-seq, dissociation duration,  lot/batch numbers for key reagents such as primers, sequencing reagent kits, etc.) or the protocol by which the sample was obtained or generated.
ImageProtocolLink.title: Image Protocol Link

ImagePyramidal.description: Does data file contain pyramid of images
ImagePyramidal.title: Image Pyramidal

ImageSoftware.description: The name of the software package that was used to capture, generate, and process the image.
ImageSoftware.title: Image Software

ImageTimeseries.description: Does data file contain a time-series of images
ImageTimeseries.title: Image Timeseries

ImageWorkingDistance.description: The working distance of the lens, expressed as a floating point number. Floating point > 0.
ImageWorkingDistance.title: Image Working Distance

ImageWorkingDistanceUnit.description: The units of the working distance. See OME enumeration of allowed values for the UnitsLength attribute -- default: microns (um)
ImageWorkingDistanceUnit.title: Image Working Distance Unit

ImageXPixels.description: Size of image: X dimension (in pixels). Integer >= 1
ImageXPixels.title: Image X Pixels

ImageYPixels.description: Size of image: Y dimension (in pixels). Integer >= 1
ImageYPixels.title: Image Y Pixels

ImageZPixels.description: Size of image: Z dimension (in pixels). Integer >= 1
ImageZPixels.title: Image Z Pixels

ImageZstack.description: Does data file contain a Z-stack of images
ImageZstack.title: Image Z stack

ImagingChannelKey.description: Unique ImagingChannel_id foreign key(s) that link metadata entries as part of the same Dataset. Please provide multiple values as a comma-separate list.
ImagingChannelKey.title: ImagingChannel Key

ImagingLevel1Key.description: Unique ImagingLevel1_id foreign key(s) that link metadata entries as part of the same Dataset. Please provide multiple values as a comma-separate list.
ImagingLevel1Key.title: ImagingLevel1 Key

ImagingLevel2Id.description: A unique identifier used by schematic for record updates and as a reference key in other schemas.
ImagingLevel2Id.title: ImagingLevel2_id
